SEARCH
Package org.jmel.mastermind.core

Class Game

java.lang.Object
org.jmel.mastermind.core.Game
public class Game extends Object
Represents a Mastermind game.

A game is played by making guesses against a secret code. The game is won when a guess matches the secret code or if the maximum number of attempts is reached. A game can be configured with a custom code length, number of colors, maximum number of attempts, secret code supplier, and feedback strategy.

  • Method Details

    • processGuess

      public Feedback processGuess(List<Integer> guessInput)
      Processes a guess against the secret code.

      A guess to be processed is considered invalid if the game is won, the maximum number of attempts was reached, or a Code object could not be instantiated. If a guess is valid, it will be added to the guess history.

      Parameters:
      guessInput - list of integers representing a guess that conforms to the game's code length and number of colors
      Returns:
      Feedback object representing the result of the guess against the secret code based on a feedback strategy
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the game is already over

    • movesCompleted

      public int movesCompleted()
      Returns the number of moves completed in the game.

      A move is considered completed if the input guess is valid and is added to the guess history.

      Returns:
      an integer representing the number of moves completed in the game

    • isGameWon

      public boolean isGameWon()
      Returns true if the game is won.

      A game is won if the last guess in the guess history is equal to the secret code.

      Returns:
      a boolean representing whether the game is won

    • codeLength

      public int codeLength()
      Returns the length of the secret code.

      This can be used to validate the length of a guess input.

      Returns:
      an integer representing the length of the secret code

    • numColors

      public int numColors()
      Returns the number of colors that can form the secret code.

      This can be used to validate the composition of a guess input.

      Returns:
      an integer representing the number of colors that can form the secret code

    • maxAttempts

      public int maxAttempts()
      Returns the number of attempts allowed in the game.

      This can be used to determine if a new guess can be processed.

      Returns:
      an integer representing the maximum number of attempts allowed in the game
